original: @73b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @73b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya kharsa p'a ni lo ke shva ra s'a dha nam /
analyzed: a'arya kharsa p'a ni lo ke shva ra s'a dha nam /
translated: Ārya-kārṣapaṇīlokeśvara-sādhana

original: bod skad du /🔽'phags pa kharsa p'a ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs /
analyzed: bod skad du / 'phags pa kharsa p'a ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: dang po re zhig sngags pas stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang po re zhig sngags pas stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
translated: First, the mantrin should sit on a comfortable seat,

original: zhal bsang ba la sogs pa byas shing /
analyzed: zhal bsang ba la sogs pa byas shing /
translated: wash his face, and so forth,

original: sbyangs nas rang gi snying gar aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyangs nas rang gi snying gar aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and having purified himself, he should meditate on a moon maṇḍala from the letter A in his heart.

original: de'i steng du hr'i:yig dkar po /
analyzed: de'i steng du hr'i:yig dkar po /
translated: Upon that, a white letter HRIH,

original: de'i 'od zer gyis mdun gyi nam mkha'i mthil du bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis mdun gyi nam mkha'i mthil du bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams spyan drangs nas /
translated: whose light rays invite the gurus, buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so forth to the surface of the sky in front.

original: snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i mchod pa'i sprin tshogs rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas /
analyzed: snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i mchod pa'i sprin tshogs rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas /
translated: Having made perfect offerings with the hosts of offering clouds arisen from the light rays of the seed syllable in the heart,

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the confession of sins and so forth, one should cultivate the four Brahma abodes.

original: de nas stong pa nyid du bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid du bsgoms te /
translated: Then, having meditated on emptiness,🔽one should bless oneself with the mantra:

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: de nas sngon bzhin du hr'i:yig rnam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de nas sngon bzhin du hr'i:yig rnam par bsgoms nas /
translated: Then, as before, one should visualize the syllable hrīḥ,

original: nam mkha'i mthil du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas de las byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthil du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas de las byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: and from that, in the manner of emanating and reabsorbing, one should meditate on oneself as Avalokiteśvara,

original: 'od zer dkar po bye ba dang ldan pa ral pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: 'od zer dkar po bye ba dang ldan pa ral pa'i cod pan can /
translated: endowed with ten million white light rays, with a crown of hair,

original: 'od dpag tu med pas dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pas dbu brgyan pa /
translated: with Amitābha as the crest jewel,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all ornaments,

original: padma dang zla ba'i gdan la skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma dang zla ba'i gdan la skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa /
translated: seated in half-lotus posture on a seat of lotus and moon,

original: phyag g-yas pa mchog sbyin /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa mchog sbyin /
translated: with the right hand in the boon-granting gesture,

original: g-yon pa padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: and the left hand holding a lotus.

original: g-yas phyogs logs na 'phags ma sgrol ma dang / nor bzangs gzhon nu gnyis so //
analyzed: g-yas phyogs logs na 'phags ma sgrol ma dang / nor bzangs gzhon nu gnyis so //
translated: To the right are the noble Tārā and the youth Sudhana.

original: g-yon gyi logs na khro gnyer can dang rta mgrin gnyis so //
analyzed: g-yon gyi logs na khro gnyer can dang rta mgrin gnyis so //
translated: To the left are Akṣayamati and Hayagrīva.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor aom yig / mgrin par a'a:yig / snying gar h'um yig bsgoms la ji srid mi skyo ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor aom yig / mgrin par a'a:yig / snying gar h'um yig bsgoms la ji srid mi skyo ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, visualize the syllable Oṃ on the crown of the Blessed One’s head, the syllable Āḥ at his throat, and the syllable Hūṃ at his heart, and meditate until one becomes weary.

original: skyo na sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: skyo na sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: When weary, one should recite the mantra.

original: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra is as follows:

original: aom hr'i:sv'a h'a zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug kharsa p'a ni'i sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: aom hr'i:sv'a h'a zhes pa ni 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug kharsa p'a ni'i sgrub thabs so //
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ svāhā. This is the sādhana of the noble Avalokiteśvara Khasarpana.

original: slob dpon rnyog pa med pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon rnyog pa med pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: Composed by the master Vimalamitra.
